channel.title: [Cant Port Forward Help!] [Not Linksys Router] [Router is Arris]
channel.description:
:mad: Ive been trying to solve this problem and i have been stupid not to come here gone to www.portforward.com and it did not work for me.
[b]Ok so you know how on linksys router you need to type your ip in the address than you can portforward . When i type my ip which starts with 65.xx.xxx.173 it just says cannot find it . I use Windows xp. And i think i need to portforward in a different way with my firewall ? or somthing like that please tell me step by step on how to fix this this would solve problems around the world with people not with a router.!!!! id realy appreciate it [/b] :] ;D :) ;) that be kool :cool:

item.title: [Cant Port Forward Help!] [Not Linksys Router] [Router is Arris]
item.dc:creator: @Itachipkx Itachipkx
item.description:
@Itachipkx wrote:

can somone try to help me with this if you can contact me at azn_andysithara@hotmail.com[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 24, 2009, 03:41:06 pm[/size][hr]somone help here this might help im using a arris modem and somone said i do not need port forwarding? but my server still dont work i cant even connect just localy just me connecting for some reason.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 25, 2009, 07:06:35 am[/size][hr]help please!!![br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 07, 2009, 04:34:57 pm[/size][hr]PLEASE HELP OMG

item.title: [Cant Port Forward Help!] [Not Linksys Router] [Router is Arris]
item.dc:creator: @alancarr123 alancarr123
item.description:
@alancarr123 wrote:

go to run>cmd
type in ipconfig
type in your gateway that it says in your internet address bar
thats all i know for linksys but i’m positive that there will be lots of video’s for it on http://www.youtube.com/

Read full topic
